Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Increase search engine indexing blocking duration to 90 days" (#9099) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Failed to download package. Response status code does not indicate success: 301 (Moved Permanently)" (#8871) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

The issue started Friday (11-05-2021 PM PST) when running `dotnet restore` on a project failed with the following errors

```
/usr/share/dotnet/sdk/5.0.401/NuGet.targets(131,5): error : Failed to retrieve information about 'Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.Abstractions' from remote source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/microsoft.extensions.dependencyinjection.abstractions/index.json'. [**.csproj]
/usr/share/dotnet/sdk/5.0.401/NuGet.targets(131,5): error :   Response status code does not indicate success: 301 (Moved Permanently). [**.csproj]
  Failed to download package 'System.Xml.XDocument.4.0.11' from 'https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/system.xml.xdocument/4.0.11/system.xml.xdocument.4.0.11.nupkg'.
  Response status code does not indicate success: 301 (Moved Permanently).
  Failed to download package 'System.Text.Encoding.Extensions.4.3.0' from 'https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/system.text.encoding.extensions/4.3.0/system.text.encoding.extensions.4.3.0.nupkg'.
  Response status code does not indicate success: 301 (Moved Permanently).
```

Entering the URL, e.g. `https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/microsoft.extensions.dependencyinjection.abstractions/index.json`  into a browser tab with Network inspection on showed that there is a redirect loop going on

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26933358/140829177-4f68ccdc-eae5-4b1a-996f-d3763f28d46c.png)

This happens at random because it depends on the DNS resolution of api.nuget.org. If I'm lucky and the requests get directed to a good server, I could restore the package, but at times I got the above error.

### Repro Steps

1. Update **hosts** file to point api.nuget.org to a problematic server. E.g. `13.107.246.18 api.nuget.org`.
2. Go to the nuget URL either with a browser or curl, e.g. `https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/microsoft.extensions.dependencyinjection.abstractions/index.json`
3. See the redirect loop


### Expected Behavior

Response 200 OK with the expected content.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

Running PowerShell

```
resolve-dnsname api.nuget.org

Name                           Type   TTL   Section    NameHost
----                           ----   ---   -------    --------
api.nuget.org                  CNAME  0     Answer     nugetapiprod.trafficmanager.net
nugetapiprod.trafficmanager.ne CNAME  0     Answer     apiprod-mscdn.azureedge.net
t
apiprod-mscdn.azureedge.net    CNAME  0     Answer     apiprod-mscdn.afd.azureedge.net
apiprod-mscdn.afd.azureedge.ne CNAME  0     Answer     star-azureedge-prod.trafficmanager.net
t
star-azureedge-prod.trafficman CNAME  0     Answer     dual.part-0042.t-0009.t-msedge.net
ager.net
dual.part-0042.t-0009.t-msedge CNAME  0     Answer     part-0042.t-0009.t-msedge.net
.net

Name       : part-0042.t-0009.t-msedge.net
QueryType  : AAAA
TTL        : 101
Section    : Answer
IP6Address : 2620:1ec:bdf::70


Name       : part-0042.t-0009.t-msedge.net
QueryType  : AAAA
TTL        : 101
Section    : Answer
IP6Address : 2620:1ec:46::70


Name       : part-0042.t-0009.t-msedge.net
QueryType  : A
TTL        : 32
Section    : Answer
IP4Address : 13.107.213.70


Name       : part-0042.t-0009.t-msedge.net
QueryType  : A
TTL        : 32
Section    : Answer
IP4Address : 13.107.246.70

t-msedge.net                   NS     93697 Authority  ns1.t-mSEdgE.NEt
t-msedge.net                   NS     93697 Authority  ns2.t-mSEdgE.NEt

Name       : ns1.t-msedge.net
QueryType  : A
TTL        : 93697
Section    : Additional
IP4Address : 13.107.246.1


Name       : ns2.t-msedge.net
QueryType  : A
TTL        : 93697
Section    : Additional
IP4Address : 13.107.246.2
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y Bug] Make TFM badges asset and compatible different for high contrast." (#9098) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
## Changes

* When high contrast, badges on table and on badge component now have border and font bolder.
* Compatible target bottom label now has a square icon with bolder border.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Many SPDX license Expressions not resolved by https://licenses.nuget.org/ instead "We have no information regarding the 'Xyz' license."" (#9097) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Feature]: Retain Command History After Closing and Opening Visual Studio" (#11759) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

Visual Studio Package Manager Console

### The Elevator Pitch

Package Manager Console does retain command history in a temporary manner but in between closing and opening of Visual Studio that history is gone. 

Please can the command history be retained after closing and opening of Visual Studio.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CommandRunnerResult works differently with dotnet.exe vs nuget.exe?" (#9190) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
In dotnetsourcestests.cs needed to use item2, where item3 worked in nuget.exe based tests

```
                // TODO: Item2 in dotnet, vs Item3 in nuget.exe -- switched
                result.Item2.Contains(expectedErrorMessage),
                "Expected error is " + expectedErrorMessage + ". Actual error is " + result.Item2);
```

Figure out difference that causes that...in order to simplify porting any tests from nuget.exe to dotnet.exe

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Remove V2 NuGet.Core dependency from the tests" (#4183) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently part of test bed heavily depends on NuGet.Core V2 code. 
Specifically the NuGet.Commandline.Test.

This needs to be removed and the functionality ported.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Package restore errors should mention which dependant package it came from" (#11758) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

6.1.0.103

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

`dotnet restore` and nuget in Visual Studio 2022.

In my project I have `SkiaSharp.Views.WindowsForms` package, which depends on OpenTK (>= 3.1.0), OpenTK.GLControl (>= 3.1.0).

My project itself also depended on OpenTK.GLControl, while attempting an upgrade I briefly uninstalled this package, but nuget keeps saying that it fails to restore it.

It's not obvious that it's still trying to restore it because another package depends on it. This error message should print the dependency path.

### Verbose Logs

```shell
Determining projects to restore...
GUI.csproj : error NU1701: Package 'OpenTK.GLControl 3.1.0' was restored using '.NETFramework,Version=v4.6.1, .NETFramework,Version=v4.6.2, .NETFramework,Version=v4.7, .NETFramework,Version=v4.7.1, .NETFramework,Version=v4.7.2, .NETFramework,Version=v4.8' instead of the project target framework 'net6.0-windows7.0'. This package may not be fully compatible with your project. [ValveResourceFormat.sln]
```
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: There is no black arrow install button on the right of custom feed package when hovering on the package in “Browse” tab of PM UI" (#11757) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.3.0.24

### Worked before?

Dev\6.3.0.12

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

1. File->New Project->Visual F#, create a Console Application project. 
2. Open Package Manager Settings dialog (Tools->NuGet Package Manager->Package Manager Settings). 
3. Add a custom feed source, type in the name is 'Myget' and the source is https://www.myget.org/F/andy-nuget-project/api/v2. 
4. Start NuGet Package Manager dialog and select the ‘Myget’ package source. 
5. Go to “Browse” tab and hover on the package 'knockoutjs'.

## Expected
There is a black download arrow on the right of package list in “Browse” Tab when hovering on the package as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71433406/163995283-6912e272-5c15-4f2a-8c76-c78dac2462b0.png)

## Actual
There is no black arrow install button on the right of custom feed package when hovering on the package as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71433406/163995344-9660c421-f5f3-4f8d-8df5-f33b70eedba9.png)

## Notes
1. This issue does not repro on NuGet Client Dev\6.3.0.12.
2. This issue does not repro on NuGet public feed.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Package manager UI should be only updated only when there is an important state change" (#11750) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Track https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4535#discussion_r848924794. Package manager UI should be only updated only when there is an important state change.

Also https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4535#discussion_r848675522 and https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4535#discussion_r848675567

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MSBuild NuGet SDK Resolver fails to locate global.json file in Visual Studio project folder" (#11747) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, MSBuild.exe

### Product Version

Visual Studio 2022 17.2 Preview 3

### Worked before?

Visual Studio 2022 17.1 and earlier

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

The issue is a dotnet CLI template which contains a global.json file (in my case referencing a project SDK) which is then also used via the Visual Studio new project dialog. So the global.json file is in the same directory as the project, but in the Visual Studio case the default creation case is to create a solution folder and a project sub-folder. The project sub-folder contains the global.json file in this case. The MSBuild NuGet SDK Resolver fails to locate the global.json file in the project folder.

The issue was trigger by this [#4380](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4380) I believe. There was a subsequent bug and a change with this [#4507](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4507).

That secondary change almost fixes the issue for me, but unfortunately it does not handle the case when the resolver context defines both a solution and project. The existing [code](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/Microsoft.Build.NuGetSdkResolver/GlobalJsonReader.cs#L100) means the solution always wins even if the project is set. The consequence is that a global.json in the project folder is not found. I believe a change to check the project file path context first would resolve this problem.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: No way to suppress very noisy "The project ... is using CentralPackageVersionManagement, a NuGet preview feature."" (#11724) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

6.0.200

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

Every single project gets a warning about using CPVM as a preview feature in the console log. This adds a lot of noise and it would be nice to be able to suppress it. 

>  The project C:\git\VS-Platform\src\Editor\Text\Test\Unit\WpfView\WpfViewUnitTests.csproj is using CentralPackageVersionManagement, a NuGet preview feature.
  Restored C:\git\VS-Platform\src\Editor\Text\Impl\InvisibleCharacterTagger\InvisibleCharacterTagger.csproj (in 387 ms).
  The project C:\git\VS-Platform\src\Editor\Text\Impl\EditorPrimitives\EditorPrimitivesImpl.csproj is using CentralPackageVersionManagement, a NuGet preview feature.
  Restored C:\git\VS-Platform\src\Editor\Text\Test\Unit\CurrentLineHighlighter\CurrentLineHighlighterTests.csproj (in 2.03 sec).


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Floating Versions in PM UI, define manual test cases for vendors " (#11453) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: With the implementation of Floating Versions, the behavior of the PM UI for installing/updating a package will change, that's why we need to update the manual test cases for our vendors so they know the new behavior and can test it to ensure there are no regressions on basic functionality.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: [ARM64] Command “nuget pack” cannot be run since could not load file or assembly 'C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\2022\Preview\MSBuild\Current\Bin\arm64\Microsoft.Build.dll'" (#11756) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

Dev\6.3.0.10

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Device info
Device: Surface Pro X
System type: ARM-based 64bit processor
OS: Windows 11 Pro 21h2
#### Installation
1.Install Preinstall from: \vspreinstall\preinstall\preinstall.cmd
2.Install Visual Studio 2022 Dogfood build from: IntPreview Channel

#### Repro steps:
1.Create a Class Library (.NET Framework 4.8) in VS and build the solution. 
2.In the Developer Command Prompt for VS, create a nuspec file by executing command “nuget spec” 
3.Make an invalid image file (with txt format) and locate in the package. 
4.Add following to nuspec file  
```
<package> 
  <metadata> 
    ... 
    <icon>images\icon.txt</icon> 
    ... 
  </metadata> 
  <files> 
    ... 
    <file src="..\icon.txt" target="images\" /> 
    ... 
  </files> 
</package> 

```
5.Cd to the project path and pack the package by executing command “nuget pack ProjectName.csproj”. 
#### Expected:
Command “nuget pack” can be run successfully.

#### Actual:
Command “nuget pack” cannot be run since could not load file or assembly 'C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\2022\Preview\MSBuild\Current\Bin\arm64\Microsoft.Build.dll' as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/163803582-ffb9d020-f012-4758-8cad-f7484de943fe.png)

#### Note:
This issue does not repro with command “nuget spec”.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_
